result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Matthew James Berres

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
CO: Cameron, RPR: Drost, Clerk: Webb, ADA:  Michael E. Nieskes, DF ATTY:  Brian Thomas Smestad   DF:  Matthew James Berres appeared.  Court called at 10:34 a.m.  Set for PTC.  Includes case 14CF75, 14CF76 & 14CM64.  DE files Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights Form with the Court.  Court reads charges and maximum penalties.  DE pleads Guilty to Ct 1  in 14CF75.  Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts.  Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Ct 1 in 14CF75. On motion of the State, Crt dismisses Ct 2 in 14CF75.  14CF76 and 14CM64 dismissed but read in for purposes of restitution. Victim rights have been complied with.  Sentencing arguments. Crt orders:

S/W 3 years probation with conditions
- 3 months conditional jail time in the St. Croix County Jail
- DE can serve his jail time in Eau Claire County if at no expense to St. Croix County 
- Court grants huber for work
- Court orders Victim Empathy Seminar
- $1,183.61 joint and several restitution to Timothy Stevenson to be paid through DOC
- $206.00 joint and several restitution to Jonathan Becker to be paid through the DOC
- $630.00 joint and several restitution to Vicki Datt to be paid through the DOC
- Court costs and DNA surcharge of $518.00 to be paid through the DOC
- Report to jail by 2:00 p.m. today 01/12/15
- Report to Eau Claire County to serve no later than 03/06/15
- 20 days to appeal

CO: Cameron, RPR: Drost, Clerk: Webb, ADA: Michael E. Nieskes, DF ATTY: Brian Thomas Smestad, DF: Matthew James Berres appeared.  Court called at 4:32 p.m.  Includes case 14CF75, 14CF76 & 14CM64.  Set for Plea/Sentencing.  Attorney Smestad advises the court that the DE has charges regarding the same incidents in Pierce County and the attorneys are working with Pierce to run the sentencing concurrent.  Set for PTC.  Possibly Plea/Sentencing.  Court adjourned at 4:37 p.m. lw Pre-trial conference scheduled for January 12, 2015 at 10:30 am.

Court adjourned at 10:37 a.m. lw  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 10, 2014 at 04:15 pm.

Attorney Smestad asks for more time to review  discovery.  PTC continued. lw  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 5, 2014 at 08:30 am.
